intro: Thelypodium micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered thelypodium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild aromatic scent. Thelypodium micranthum is native to Europe and parts of Asia, where it is often found in temperate regions.
